alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EDT, trained weather spotters and NWS employee reported an ice jam near Donnelly Island and Donnelly Brook along the Aroostook River in Wade causing minor flooding upstream from the jam. Gardner Creek Road over Gardner Brook is flooded. As of 7:15 PM this evening the ice jam was reported by the public as still being in place. - Areas near Gardner Brook and the Aroostook River upstream of the jam are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Gardner Brook and Aroostook River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
